events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30, 2024, involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured’s car in a collision.
An agent was assigned to the case promptly to begin handling the claim and coordinate next steps with the insured.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the insured about the process timeline.
The agent requested essential documents from the insured, including photographs of the damaged vehicle and the police accident report.
The insured submitted all requested documents, including detailed images of vehicle damage and a copy of the official accident report.
Claims investigators began reviewing the submitted evidence to determine fault and assess the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation concluded finding that the insured was not at fault and the damages to the vehicle are consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement offer was sent to the insured covering all repair costs and additional compensation for car rental during repairs.
The insured provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with how quickly and fairly the claim was handled.
The claim approval was finalized authorizing the payments as per the agreed settlement offer for vehicle repairs.
Insurance payment was issued to the insured’s account promptly, covering all previously agreed costs for the damages.
The claim was officially closed after confirming completion of vehicle repairs and receipt of the insurance settlement.
All documentation and records for the claim have been archived in compliance with company policies and data retention standards.
